title: Manchester police invite Liverpool legend Robbie Fowler in for tour of station
text:

Liverpool legend Robbie Fowler has been invited on a tour of Middleton police station in Greater Manchester. 
The cheeky offer was put to Fowler on Twitter after he jokingly urged his followers to complain about GMP Middleton's Twitter account after they posted a tweet mocking the Reds' poor form in February. 
The initial tweet, written on Wednesday when new driving regulations came in, said: "Use your mobile phone and drive as of today you’ll end up with more points on your licence than Liverpool FC got throughout February SIX.” 
Fowler responded by posting a copy of the force’s official complaints procedure - a tweet which has since been deleted. Liverpool legend Fowler scored 163 times in the Premier League (Photo: Reuters) 
GMP Middleton clearly caught wind of Fowler's tweet and responded on Thursday morning, writing: "Seems we upset Robbie Fowler yesterday. Come for a tour of the station & if you're good put the blue lights on a Police car as an apology." 
The Anfield favourite then tweeted: "Honestly you never (upset me)... But starting to now by not understanding my sending you a joke to combat yours.." 
The Middleton force accepted Fowler was joking and then extended the offer of a ride along to the 163-goal ex-Premier League marksman. 
We wonder if Fowler will accept that offer. Probably not. Like us on Facebook
